title: olsrd.conf not found and errors on LinkQualityDijkstraLimit and LinkQualityWinSize

sentences.text: olsrd started from /etc/init.d/olsrd looks for /etc/olsrd.conf instead of /etc/olsrd/olsrd.conf and aborts not finding the configuration file.
Further olsrd reports errors on the options LinkQualityDijkstraLimit and LinkQualityWinSize in olsrd.conf.
Commenting these two options out lets olsrd start without errors.
Versions of packages olsrd depends on:
# every card is configured with is used
# IPv6 multicast address to use when
# If not defined, ff05::15 is used

# If not defined, ff0e::1 is used
# If not defined, RFC proposed values will

# the weight of interface is used to determine

# but here you can specify a fixed value.
# Olsrd will choose links with the lowest value.
# If a certain route should be preferred
# or ignored by the mesh, the Link Quality
# value of a node can be multiplied with a factor
# A multiplier of 0.5 will result in a small
# This multiplier applies to all other nodes
# IPC connections that will be allowed
# You can also specify entire net-ranges
# Here parameters are set to be sent to the
# Parameters ofcause, differs from plugin to plugin.
# Consult the documentation of your plugin for details.
# how often to check for Internet connectivity
# if one or more IPv4 addresses are given, do a ping on these in     # descending order to validate that there is not only an entry in     # routing table, but also a real internet connection.
If any of     # these addresses could be pinged successfully, the test was     # succesful, i.e. if the ping on the 1st address was successful,the     # 2nd won't be pinged
I'm just uploading the new olsrd 0.6.2-1 to Debian and removed the two obsolete options from the default configuration file.
However, I couldn't reproduce the /etc/olsrd/olsrd.conf path issue
I assume that you still had an old version of this file present and upon package upgrade, you didn't get the new contents of this Debian conf file.
If this is not the case and the problem persists, please reopen the bug after it automatically closes by Debian package upload procedures.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of olsrd, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 652690@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Roland Stigge <stigge@antcom.de> (supplier of updated olsrd package)

if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
olsrd-plugins - various plugins to enhance olsrd
* New upstream release (repackaged and cleaned from debian/ dir)
* Removing obsolete options LinkQualityDijkstraLimit and LinkQualityWinSize      from default configuration file (Closes: #652690)
